Structure of [[algebraic groups]] | workplaces = | alma_mater = [[Princeton University]] | doctoral_advisor = [[Goro Shimura]] | academic_advisors = | doctoral_students = | notable_students = | known_for = | author_abbrev_bot = | author_abbrev_zoo = | influences = [[Robert Langlands]] | influenced = | awards = | signature = | signature_alt = | footnotes = }} '''William Allen "Bill" Casselman''' (born November 27, 1941) is an [[American Canadian]] mathematician who works in [[group theory]]. He is closely connected to the [[Langlands program]] and has been involved in posting all of the work of [[Robert Langlands]] on the internet.[http://publications.ias.edu/rpl/ Institute for Advanced Study: The Work of Robert Langlands] ==Work== Casselman did his undergraduate work at [[Harvard College]] where his advisor was [[Raoul Bott]] and received his Ph.D from [[Princeton University]] in 1966 where his advisor was [[Goro Shimura]]. He was a visiting scholar at the [[Institute for Advanced Study]] in 1974, 1983, and 2001.[http://www.ias.edu/people/cos/users/cass Institute for Advanced Study: A Community of Scholars: Casselman, William] He emigrated to Canada in 1971 and is now Professor Emeritus in mathematics at the [[University of British Columbia]] in [[Vancouver, British Columbia]].[https://www.directory.ubc.ca/index.cfm?d=83I%3E%3CR_%2A%23O-6OD8%21%243%2EW2%22I5RT%2C6H%24H%3A%3C%0A UBC Faculty & Administrative Directory: Dr William Casselman] Casselman specializes in [[representation theory]], [[automorphic forms]], [[geometric combinatorics]], and the structure of [[algebraic groups]]. He has a special interest in Mathematical graphics[http://www.ams.org/notices/200701/rev-roegel.pdf ''Mathematical Illustrations: A Manual of Geometry and PostScript'' reviewed by Denis Roegel] in Notices of the AMS and has been been the graphics editor of the ''Notices of the American Mathematical Society'' since January, 2001.[http://www.ams.org/notices/editors.html Notices of the American Mathematical Society: Editors and Staff] In 2012, he became one of the inaugural [[fellow]]s of the [[American Mathematical Society]].{{citation|url=http://www.ams.org/profession/fellows-list|title=List of Fellows of the American Mathematical Society|accessdate=2015-11-18}}. ==Selected publications== * On some results of Atkin and Lehner, Mathematische Annalen 201 (1973), 301-314 * ''Mathematical Illustrations: A Manual of Geometry and PostScript'', by Bill Casselman, Cambridge University Press, 2005, ISBN 0521839211 ==References== {{Reflist}} ==External links== * [http://www.math.ubc.ca/~cass/research/publications.html Publications of Bill Casselman] * [https://www.math.ubc.ca/~cass/ Bill Casselman's Home Page] * [http://genealogy.math.ndsu.nodak.edu/id.php?id=28397 William Allen Casselman at the Mathematics Genealogy Project] {{DEFAULTSORT:Casselman, William Allen}} [[Category:1941 births]] [[Category:Group theorists]] [[Category:Algebraists]] [[Category:20th-century mathematicians]] [[Category:21st-century mathematicians]] [[Category:Canadian mathematicians]] [[Category:University of British Columbia faculty]] [[Category:Institute for Advanced Study visiting scholars]] [[Category:Harvard University alumni]] [[Category:Princeton University alumni]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:Fellows of the American Mathematical Society]] [[Category:People from Glen Ridge, New Jersey]]
